item.title: Networking without an OS
item.description:
Description

Speaker: Josh Triplett

Many Python modules, such as socket and select, wrap low-level functionality written in C and provided by the OS. But what if you don't have an OS, and don't want any C code? We implemented client and server networking in Python itself, for a bare-metal environment running without an OS.

Our socket and select implementations support Python HTTP server and client modules, which we'll demo live.

Slides can be found at: https://speakerdeck.com/pycon2016 and https://github.com/PyCon/2016-slides
item.dc:creator: Josh Triplett

item.title: Porting Python to run without an OS
item.description:
Description

We've ported Python to run directly on hardware, without an OS, as a testing and exploration environment for firmware, ACPI, and UEFI. This talk will explore porting Python to a new platform, embedding Python, recreating enough of libc and POSIX to run Python without an OS, and binding to platform-specific services. Includes live demo of bare-metal Python, directly driving hardware.
